title: Decluttering a closet
context: Decide out loud which old shirts to throw away or donate.

content.bestLine: I'm keeping the good ones, donating the rest

neutral.text: Which shirts are still in good condition?
I think I'll donate these old shirts
Let's sort them into keep and donate piles
This one is still nice, I'll keep it
I haven't worn this in years, it's gone
We can give these to charity
I'm getting rid of all the stained ones
Do you think this shirt is worth keeping?

informal.text: Ditch the ugly ones, keep the cool ones
I'm so over these old shirts, bye
Let's get rid of the ones that are so last season
I'm keeping the ones that are still fire
These shirts are so played out, donate them
I'm only keeping the ones that make me look good
Get rid of the ones with holes, duh
Keep the ones that are still on trend

slang.text: Lowkey keeping the comfy ones, highkey ditching the rest
Slay the fashion game, get rid of the whack shirts
No cap, these shirts are straight fire or trash
I'm ghosting these old shirts, they're so extra
Sis, these shirts are so last season, bye
I'm only keeping the ones that are turnt

patterns.template: Let's get rid of the [options] ones
patterns.meaning: deciding which shirts to donate or throw away

dialogs.description: Deciding which shirts to keep or donate

lines.speaker: Person 1
lines.text: Which shirts do you think we should keep?

lines.speaker: Person 2
lines.text: I think we should keep the ones that are still in good condition

dialogs.description: Discussing the fate of old shirts

lines.speaker: Person 1
lines.text: I'm so over these old shirts, let's donate them

lines.speaker: Person 2
lines.text: But what about the ones that are still cool?
